definition: poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly

sentences.english: The social worker had to deal with the poor family's mistrust of strangers.
sentences.chinese: 該社工人員必須應付這戶窮苦人家對陌生人的不信任。

sentences.english: Opposing tyranny, he led a poor life, and was very miserable in his late years.
sentences.chinese: 由於反抗暴政，他過得很窮苦，晚境淒涼。

sentences.english: He seizes the poor, drawing them up in his net.
sentences.chinese: 他拉網，就把窮苦人掠去。

sentences.english: He had been proscribed, a wanderer, poor.
sentences.chinese: 他曾被放逐，四處奔波，窮苦。

sentences.english: It seems to be the instinct of certain wretched families to break the thread.
sentences.chinese: 斷盡骨肉關係好象是某些窮苦人家的本能。

sentences.english: He will take pity on the weak and the needy and save the needy from death.
sentences.chinese: 他要憐恤貧寒和窮乏的人，拯救窮苦人的性命。

sentences.english: Elizia was a poor village girl in Phynaxia.
sentences.chinese: 依麗紗是菲那西安一個村莊的窮苦女孩。

sentences.english: Miss Jiang used to lead the poor common people in resisting the grain levy and compulsory conscription.
sentences.chinese: 江姐曾經在華鎣山帶領窮苦百姓抗糧抗丁。

sentences.english: The prince had appeared and subjugated the poor little handmaid.
sentences.chinese: 王子出現了，這使窮苦的小丫頭不勝仰慕。

sentences.english: He has abased himself by stealing from a poor old woman.
sentences.chinese: 他因偷了一個窮苦老婦的東西而喪失了人格。

sentences.english: The wealthy experience more mirth than the poor, but not much. Most people say they are happy, but perhaps that is because they are expected to be.
sentences.chinese: 有錢的人要比那些窮苦的人幸福，但是相差不多。

sentences.english: In the training period, Chen called Jon life in the poorest stage.
sentences.chinese: 在培訓的那段時間，堪稱陳喬恩人生中最窮苦的階段。

sentences.english: He extorted money from poor farmers under false pretences.
sentences.chinese: 他訛詐窮苦農民的錢財。

sentences.english: My hombres and me, we are poor people.
sentences.chinese: 許多窮苦人聚集在門口。

sentences.english: After a long delay, the cabled money finally came through to the destitute family.
sentences.chinese: 耽擱很久之後，縉來的錢終於到了那家窮苦人的手上。

sentences.english: He came from a poor family.

definition: to have enough food and warm clothes/adequately provided
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
glory, splendor, wealth and rank (idiom); high position and great wealth
to live one's life/to make a living
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
willing (to do sth)/to take pleasure in
